programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Only Jack knows the truth when Chrissy, Janet and Mrs. Roper think Stanley is fooling around with another woman.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Roper's on a rampage for the rent so Jack's visiting uncle, a charming rascal, passes him a bad check.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: James moves in to care for Vicky when she comes down with the measles.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: When Jack is asked to identify a counterfeiter, Mr. Bradford appears in the police lineup.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: Jack and Vicky argue over money. Mr. Bradford offers to pay for sprinklers that Jack needs for the bistro if Jack can convince Vicky to marry him.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: Jack thinks Vicky is pregnant, but it's E.Z.'s dog who is expecting.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: After James falls for a young artist, Jack tries to save him from heartbreak.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: Jack mistakenly believes that Vicky's friend is coming onto him.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: Jack butts heads with James on a radio debate show.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: James tries to match his ex-wife with a business acquaintance, hoping to cease paying her alimony.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: With his ego bruised after to losing a trivia game to Vicky, Jack tries to best her but ends up embarrassing himself at a beach carnival in front of guests.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Marlene finds herself the object of a secret admirer who leaves her flowers and love notes. At the same time, Bannister starts giving advice to Derek, the young bag boy who might be in over his head.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Bannister learns that the new owners have sent out a corporate spy to infiltrate Cobb's and warns the staff to be on guard. The result is an atmosphere of paranoia as everyone suspects each other of spying.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: When Bannister learns Cobb's is to be featured on an investigative news program, he gets excited at the thought of being seen on television coast-to-coast. The trouble happens when the show writer decides she doesn't want him to be seen.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: There is a new Cobb's store about to open and Christian and Edna have both been selected as potential managers. Bannister is convinced Edna doesn't have a chance so he secretly endorses Christian.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.sub-title: Who's Afraid of the Big Bad Wolf?
programme.desc: Sara's dinner date with the bank manager brings a quick promotion and office gossip about what she did to earn it.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Henry's boss, Mr. Wainwright, creates an uproar at the theatre when he and Henry try to catch a thief who snatched Sara's purse.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: The lion starring in a student film being shot in the girls' apartment becomes and uninvited guest at Muriel and Henry's dinner party.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Muriel's old flame comes to dinner when he is passing through town with his band, but his eye is on Jackie.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Monroe mistakes Mildred Rafkin for his sex surrogate.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Muriel's college pal propositions Henry while visiting the Rushes.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: It's contract negotiation time at Cobb's and after 12 years, Bannister feels he deserves a raise.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Brad forces Jackie to choose between being his wife or having a career.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Henry brings a hungry Andrew to a photo session so Muriel can nurse him.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: The Rush family's Christmas ski trip to Mammoth has to be cancelled when Andrew comes down with a fever. As they plan Christmas at home, Jackie brings home a friend from the store she works in, Mr. Christmas, a black Santa who really believes he is Santa Claus.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Iris falls for a fortune hunter and it is up to Henry to save her from heartbreak.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Sara is the victim of questionable journalism practices when a picture of her face is put on a nude body in a men's magazine.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Henry and Monroe come to the aid of Wainwright's attractive young messenger who faints in the Rushes' apartment.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Iris's revelation that Muriel was adopted sends Muriel searching for her natural mother.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: The Rushes hire a pair of hapless brothers to convert their attic into an apartment for Iris.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: The wedding of Henry's lifelong friend to a young Las Vegas showgirl upsets the groom's sons from his previous marriage.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Bannister puts Christian in charge of Cobbs while he goes on vacation. Christian makes life so miserable for the rest of the staff, they snitch when Bannister gets back. For revenge, Christian tells Marlene she's won a trip, but this backfires when Marlene gets her grandmother involved.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: One of Cobb's favorite customers is Mr. Dale, an old vaudeville comic. When Mr. Dale reveals his retirement home will close unless money is raised, Bannister gives him a job at Cobb's.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: While showing his children's birthday party routine to Edna, TC arrives at Cobb's with a corporate psychiatrist.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Marlene is approached by a writer for 'Women of the World' magazine, who wants to interview her. Bannister tries to convince her not to do it, when it's revealed that Marlene must pose nude!

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Bannister gets the notion that he can make money by writing a romance novel, so he locks himself in the office to write it. To gain sales, he puts the advertises it in the supermarket. The staff are shocked to find all the sleezy characters are based on them.

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Susan gets depressed after a younger woman gets her job and she is asked to make a speech at a school reunion only because four other ex-pupils were unavailable.

programme.desc: Brad forces Jackie to choose between being his wife or having a career.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: When Stanley is being inattentive towards Helen, she decides to make him jealous by pretending to have an affair with the gardener. Both Anne and Jeffrey Brookes decide to help out and also hire some other guys to pose as Helen's lover.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Both Stanley and Jeffrey argue with their wives and walk out on them at the same time. Getting drunk at a bar brings them together as buddies, but sobering up may open their eyes to a big problem they've unwittingly created.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: Jack and Vicky argue over money. Mr. Bradford offers to pay for sprinklers that Jack needs for the bistro if Jack can convince Vicky to marry him.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: To get Vicky to accept his standing marriage proposal, Jack attempts to reunite Vicky's divorced parents. First appearance of Mrs. Bradford.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Jack and Janet find a new roommate after Cindy moves off dormitory life at nearby UCLA. She's Terri Alden, an emergency room nurse who starts off on the wrong foot with Jack in this sixth-season opener.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Larry has made his choice for a new roommate and Jack and Larry begin devising a plan to get rid of Terri.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: To boost Jack's confidence, Terri turns on the charm, causing Janet to suspect that her new roommate's interest in Jack is more than platonic.
